# ***HTML Text, CSS Introduction, and Basic JavaScript Instructions***


## ***1-HTML Text***

in this section we will talk about the markup. we have 2 types of markup, the structural markup and the semantic markup 

### **the structural markup:**
 the elements that you can use to describe both headings and paragraphs.

 for example:
 
 1- Headings:
 ```
<h1>
<h2>
<h3>
<h4>
<h5>
<h6>
 ```
 the h1 is the highest and h6 is the lowest

 2- Paragraphs:
 ```
<p>Text is easier to understand when it is split up
into units of text. For example, a book may have
chapters. Chapters can have subheadings. Under
each heading there will be one or more
paragraphs.</p>
 ```
 3- bold and italic

 we can use b tag for bold and i tag for italic
 ```
<p>This is how we make a word appear <b>bold.</b>
</p>
<p>This is how we make a word appear <i>italic</i>.
</p>
 ```

### **the semantic markup:**  
the markups that we use to provide extra information.

for example:

1-strong

we can use this tag to give the word inside it a big importance
```
<strong>Beware:</strong>
```
2-blockquots

we use this tag to quots lark=g paragraphs
```
<blockquote cite="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/
Winnie-the-Pooh">
<p>Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start
again?</p>
```
3-address

we use this element to contain the contact details for the page auther.
```
<address>
<p><a href="mailto:homer@example.org">
homer@example.org</a></p>
<p>742 Evergreen Terrace, Springfield.</p>
</address>
```

## ***CSS Introduction***

the css is a language that can make your web page looks more attractive and . if the HTML is the skaletton of the web page, the css will be like the skin of it. and this can be happened by somthing called rules.

### rules contains two parts: 

a selector and a declaration.
![hjh](https://miro.medium.com/max/3840/1*naFDyXh9iGtmvNRhhFY-og.png)

#### **the selector**

it is the name that we use to call what we want to edit its looks, and ther are many of them 
![jhjh](https://csharpcorner.azureedge.net/UploadFile/9a9e6f/selectors-in-css/Images/types%20of%20selectors.jpg)


#### **the decleration**

it is what we want to do or change for the selector and it depend on the type of the selector.

![kkk](https://www.tutorialrepublic.com/lib/images/css-selector.png)

for example:
* we can change the color, font type and background color for texts
* we can change the wedth and the depth for pictures
* we can change the bordar type and color for tables

### how to make css commands

* External CSS

    by using link inside the html file and write the rules in css file
* Internal CSS

    by using style tag inside the head tag in the html file
* INLINE CSS

    by using style tag inside the selector 


we should know that its better to use an external css file if we want to apply our work on other pages. and use the internal css if we have only one page.

## ***Basic JavaScript Instructions***

![kkk](data:image/png;base64,)
### **Statement**
A script is a series of instructions that a computer can follow one-by-one.
Each individual instruction or step is known as a statement.
### **Comments**
we can us the comments to write an explination about the code and it will not be showen to the user 

we have two types of comments:
* one line comment which can be written after // 
* multi line comment which can be written between /* */


### **Variable**
we use the variable to store deferent type of data in it 
and that can be done as following:
```
var name="feras"
```
after making the variable we can change it value using = like following
```
name="waleed"
```
### **Data type**
we have a lot of types for example 
```
numbers 1,2,3,4
string   "any thing"
boolean  true or false
```
### **Arrays**
we can use the arrays to store more than one value inside the variable.
and that can be done as following
```
var colors;
colors ['white', 'black', ' custom '];
var el document.getElementByld('col ors');
el . textContent = col ors[O];
```
note that ```color[0]``` will give you the first value 

```color[1]```will give you the second value

### **Operators**
we can use the operators to make a new value,
we can use them with numbers,strings and booleans
![jhu,k](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/zIQKbpmdKa4/maxresdefault.jpg)


### **Evalution condition**

we have a lot of examples for the evalution condition:

 #### IS EQUAL TO ==
 its compair if 2 values are the same 
 #### IS NOT EQUAL TO !=
 its check if 2 values are not the same 
 #### STRICT EQUAL TO ===
 its check if 2 values if thay are from the same type and the same value 
 #### STRICT NOT EQUAL TO !==
 the oposit of ===
 #### GREATER THAN >
 its check if the first number is bigger than the second one 
 (workes only with number)
 #### LESS THEN <
its check if the first number is less than the second one 
 (workes only with number)

 ### **Logical operators**
 they return a boolean between true or false

 * && which means and and need both sides to be true to give you an true value.
 * || which means or and it need only one side to be true to give you a true value.
 * ! which means not and will invert the boolean value
![fffg](https://www.devopsschool.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/JavaScript-Logical-Operator.png)


 ### **if statement**
 the if statment has acondition in the bigginning, if its true it will run the code block 

 ```
if (score>= 50) { II If score is 50 or higher
msg = 'Congratulations!';
msg += ' Proceed to the next round . ' ;
}
 ```

 ### **if else statment**
 the same as the if but if the condition is false the code block under the else will be run.

 ```
if (score >= pass) {
msg = 'Congratulations, you passed!';
} else {
msg = 'Have another go!';
var el = document .getElementByld('answer');
el .textContent = msg;
 ```
 ![gfhghg](https://www.guru99.com/images/JavaScript/javascript5_1.png)
